content: Indian actress **Sasha Selvaraj**, better known by her [stage name](/wiki/Stage_name) **Ranjini**, is a Singaporean actress known for her roles in Indian cinema, specifically [Tamil](/wiki/Tamil_cinema), [Telugu](/wiki/Telugu_cinema), and [Malayalam](/wiki/Malayalam_cinema) films. Ranjini made her debut in the 1985 Tamil film *[Muthal Mariyathai](/wiki/Muthal_Mariyathai)* directed by [Bharathiraja](/wiki/Bharathiraja). In 1987, she acted in [Lenin Rajendran](/wiki/Lenin_Rajendran)'s *[Swathi Thirunal](/wiki/Swathi_Thirunal_(1987_film))*, a biopic on the Travancore ruler of the same name. Her third Malayalam film *[Chithram](/wiki/Chithram)* (1988), written and directed by [Priyadarshan](/wiki/Priyadarshan), went on to become a huge box office success which is still holding the records for numerous feats in the Malayalam movie industry. *[Koothara](/wiki/Koothara)*, directed by Srinath Rajendran, marked her comeback to acting after a hiatus of two decades. ## Career Ranjini was born in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) as Sasha to Selvaraj and Lilly, belonging to fourth generation residents of Singapore, with roots from [Tirunelveli](/wiki/Tirunelveli), [Tamil Nadu](/wiki/Tamil_Nadu). She was introduced to films by famous director [Bharathiraja](/wiki/Bharathiraja), a friend of her father. Bharathiraja gave her the screen name of "Ranjini" for his 1985 film *[Muthal Mariyathai](/wiki/Muthal_Mariyathai)*. Ranjini, whose family was in Singapore then had flown down to Chennai taking a break from studies with the hope that the shooting would get over within two weeks. Her first Malayalam film was *[Swathi Thirunal](/wiki/Swathi_Thirunal_(film))* in 1987, a [National Film Awards](/wiki/National_Film_Awards) feature directed by [Lenin Rajendran](/wiki/Lenin_Rajendran). The film was a critical success and she won The Cinema Express Award for Best Actress. She went on to act in Malayalam films like *[Chithram](/wiki/Chithram)*, *[Mukunthetta Sumitra Vilikkunnu](/wiki/Mukunthetta_Sumitra_Vilikkunnu)* (1988) and *[Kottayam Kunjachan](/wiki/Kottayam_Kunjachan)* (1990). Ranjini quit acting in films at the peak of her career to move to London, where she continued her studies. Her last film was *[Customs Diary](/wiki/Customs_Diary)* (1993), directed by TS Suresh Babu. Ranjini was in the committee of "Nirbhaya-Kochi", an initiative of district administration under Ernakulam District Collector, M. G. Rajamanickam [IAS](/wiki/Indian_Administrative_Service) (The Welfare for Women & Children Safety) in 2014. She was also in the founding committee of "Stree", a project for Women and Health under Maradu municipality in 2016. She regularly appears as a panelist on TV debates for various social topics on National, [Malayalam](/wiki/Malayalam) and [Tamil](/wiki/Tamil_language) channels. In 2018, she was one of 12 elite panelists invited by The National Commission for Women to a discussion on sexual harassment in the workplace and she head of [Hema Committee report](/wiki/Hema_Committee_report). Ranjini is known for her voice against the [Supreme Court](/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_India) [verdict on women-entry at Sabarimala](/wiki/Entry_of_women_to_Sabarimala#History#Supreme_Court_verdict). She was also instrumental in stopping TV counselling shows i.e. *Nijangal & Solvathellam Unmai*. In 2023, she made her debut in television series through *Chandrikayilaliyunna Chandrakantham* airing on [Asianet](/wiki/Asianet_(TV_channel)). Ranjini moves [High Court of Kerala](/wiki/High_Court_of_Kerala) against the order to release [Hema Committee report](/wiki/Hema_Committee_report) stating that there is an infringement of hers and others who appeared before the committee of their confidentiality and privacy and they have the legal right to see this report and asking to give their consent for the publication. ## Personal life She married [Malayali](/wiki/Malayalis) businessman Pierre Kombara. In [London](/wiki/London), she also did a degree in credit management and later acquired a law degree. She also worked for the [BBC](/wiki/BBC) for a short time. She is a graduate lawyer and is currently working as a joint director in an overseas education institution in [Kochi](/wiki/Kochi), [Kerala](/wiki/Kerala). Ranjini is also an avid wildlife and environmental activist. ## Filmography ### Tamil films YearFilmCharacterNotes1985*[Mudhal Mariyathai](/wiki/Mudhal_Mariyathai)*SevuliTamil debut1986*Avalai Cholli
